website_summaries.verdict: Though it can be slow at times, the Motorola Moto X4 hits all the notes for the right price, making it an even better deal now than when it launched.
pros: The Moto X4 is water-resistant, has NFC, expandable memory and dual rear cameras
Motorola's variant comes with tons of useful software tricks
It's a worthy alternative to the Moto G6 Play
cons: The phone's camera is slow to launch and snap photos
Its wide-angle camera warps straight lines too severely

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Cell Phone
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what a $1000 phone can do, but this phone can do everything I need a cell phone to do, and more for a quarter of the cost. It goes all day on a charge. It charges quickly. I'm really pleased with this phone, and I don't think I will ever let a service provider hold me hostage via a lease for an overpriced phone. This phone works GREAT with GOOGLE-Fi.

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone for the money

Rear camera quality is a big step up from the MOTO G5 plus. Battery life is about the same as the MOTO G5 plus. I do like the larger charging port on the X4. LOVE that it is an android one phone. It updated to android 9 as soon as I powered it up. Would highly recommend this phone.

customer_reviews.title: Very recommended

customer_reviews.author: Mirna Romero

customer_reviews.title: Great phone.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Very nice user interface. A little faster processor than my Moto G6. The battery life is about the same as my Moto G6, which by the way is pretty good. The battery life could and should be better on the X4 considering it has a better processor than the G6. The camera is slightly better than my Moto G6. The phone is a much better value than my iPhone SE. Well worth the money. So good I bought a second phone for my wife.

customer_reviews.title: Good phone

The X4 has a few of the features that my MotoX 2nd gen had. I loved the driving mode that the 2nd Gen had...while the X4 doesn't work quite as well as the 2nd Gen did, I still like the fact that "OK Google" will unlock the screen and listen for my commands. The G5+ didn't do that at all. You had to unlock it with a push of the power button and then swipe up to unlock it before it would listen for "OK Google"
customer_reviews.author: Denjenks

customer_reviews.title: Very poor front camera, decent screen and good for one handed use.
customer_reviews.text: The front camera is really poor, so if you use it for video chatting I don't recommend this phone. The rear camera is decent, although the wide angle lens produces less than satisfactory results. Battery lasts day long for now, turbo charge works well. Also - there are some interesting features missing in the Android one phone which are present in the retail version. Notably, fingerprint sensor navigation and wireless audio. Bummed about this.
customer_reviews.author: Bajal

customer_reviews.title: Great phone with lots of extra's  for a great price

It has never happened again and I could never figure out why that happened. Usually I can go two days without charging-considering I am not a heavy user this seems to be fairly good. One thing I don't like is the fact there is no WiFi calling option. This would be a very big red flag, except our wireless provider (Consumer Cellular) can't offer WiFi calling to AT&T customers. Overall I have been pleased with the performance and the number of "bells and Whistles" for the low price ($150 at Amazon).
customer_reviews.author: RFR

customer_reviews.title: Charging problems
customer_reviews.text: I liked this phone overall, buy I think I am going to return it and get a different one. Problem is it isn't charging correctly. The piece that fits into the phone (which is NOT the std android charging connector) doesn't stay plugged in, and last night, even though it was plugged in, the phone wouldn't charge until I restarted it this morning. That's less than 4 weeks in. I have had charging problems with phones before but never this early. That combined with the non-standard plug makes me think there will be more problems if I choose to just have them replace it with the same phone.
customer_reviews.author: m.lee

customer_reviews.title: Great unlocked phone that works on either GSM or CDMA networks.
customer_reviews.text: I love these Moto phones since they do have some tech support and they are not the most expensive phones on the market. With most of the Moto UNLOCKED phones the unlocked (especially the US version) allows you to pick your own carrier (budget or big name carrier) and switch to a most any new carrier if you need to by simply contacting your new carrier and ordering a new Simm card from your new carrier (normally about $5-$10 for a new carrier's SIMM Card) and popping the new Simm into your phone and now you are in business. No more long term contracts.

She's not a heavy gamer so I can't comment on that, but all her apps run smooth and snappy. This isn't a detailed review at all, but for an average user with fairly simple needs this phone has been more than enough at a reasonable price under 200 dollars.
